intro: Gnaphalium leucopilinum, commonly known as silverleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are silver-gray in appearance due to a dense covering of fine hairs, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Gnaphalium leucopilinum is often found in moist soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
